Kayako - ticket id 60073150 // Keyur Saxena commented publicly: Hello Ian,

The only clustering-related bugfix I see in the release notes (Product Releases [https://gfi.ai/products-and-solutions/network-management-solutions/exinda-networkorchestrator/resources/documentation/product-releases]) is in 7.5.7:
"A bug was fixed where data could get corrupted when exindas were operating in High Availability mode, causing garbled records to appear in charts and reports."

There is no mention of a specific "no policy" bugfix.

Best regards,
Keyur Saxena

Kayako - ticket id 60073150 // Marcio Zimerman commented publicly: Hi Ian,

Thank you for contacting the Exinda Support Team.

Exinda version 7.6.0 is now available and includes a range of fixes and enhancements compared to version 7.5.5. We recommend reviewing the update details and considering the upgrade if it suits your environment.
You can find more information by visiting the following page: https://upgrade.gfi.com/

Just select Exinda as the product and 7.5.5 as the version to view the release details.

Let us know if you have any questions or need assistance with the upgrade process.

Best regards,
Marcio Zimerman
GFI - Exinda Network Orchestrator Support Team
